{include "default_salutation"} –

With a new year comes the start of a new "lege" season!

Alabama's 2021 Legislative Session will kick off on Tuesday, February 2. Bills have already been filed that we oppose, like HB 1 and SB 10, which attack transgender youth. There are also filed bills that we support, like HB 83 and HB 102, which would expand voting rights for all Alabamians.

Although this session will feature new guidelines due to the COVID-19 pandemic, you can still use your much-needed voice to defend civil rights and liberties.

We will be hosting collaborative webinars to prep allies and supporters to take an active part in our advocacy work. Come join us as we prepare to fight for what's important to us in Alabama.

Werk The Lege:
January 2021 Events

The Alabama Legislative season will start on February 2, 2021. Join us for collaborative webinars as we prepare to fight for what's important to us in Alabama.

Thursday, January 21
Tuesday, January 26
6 – 7 p.m.
On Zoom

Jan 21
Jan 26

Please note: This link will take you to a third-party website, zoom.us.

These presentations will include:

  • Explaining the legislative process and what you need to know about the State House COVID-19 guidelines this session.
  • How to effectively lobby members of the legislature.
  • Breaking down the ACLU of Alabama's leading priorities on reforming the criminal legal system, expanding voting rights, and stopping threats to trans healthcare access.
  • How activists are organizing for criminal justice reform and stopping prison construction.
  • How to get involved, take action, and join us in advocating for change.

Please note that both webinars are free, and you MUST register at the Zoom registration link to receive a confirmation email to attend.

We need your collective power this 2021 legislative session. Will you join us?
